intro: Gilia androsacea, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fibrous roots help it survive in harsh, desert conditions.
